snippet: “Lifestyle” programs, which aim to reduce health risks via weight loss or stress management, resulted in no net savings, a RAND study says.
abstract: RAND Corp study says so-called lifestyle management programs offered by companies to their employees, which aim to reduce health risks via weight loss or stress management, result in no net cost savings; study examined more than 67,000 people eligible to participate in PepsiCo's wellness program.
lead_paragraph: “Lifestyle” programs, which aim to reduce health risks via weight loss or stress management, resulted in no net savings, a RAND study says.

headline.main: Study Raises Questions for Employer Wellness Programs
headline.print_headline: Study Raises Questions for Employer Health Efforts
